text: Graphene?!?!?   That's crazy. Graphene is an incredible material that has the potential to be - when we manage to manufacture long chains of it - the strongest, lightest material ever made. But we can't make it in long chains yet, only in tiny particles that can be easily lifted by air currents. These particles can enter your lungs and have no way of being flushed out.  It's like asbestos squared.  It's insane that they included loose graphene in any medical device.

text:
As a OSHA certified Safety Coordinator for my company, I've been "anti-mask" from the start - so yes, I knew about this from the start. I read that these graphene particles were moleculary similar to asbestos and exposed the wearer to similar risk. But don't get me started on the failure of OSHA to push back against the one-size-fits-all model of mandating PPE in the workplace without the prerequisite protocols in place then and now. My soul weeps for the poor folks, like the staff at the Tim Horton's where I get my coffee on the way to my essential work every morning, forced to spend their entire shift wearing a snot bag. I said to anyone who would listen last year that when snot bags became a fashion statement we as a culture were done - and the speed with which that actually happened (promoted in fact by the CBC) was truly astonishing. Spoke with one of my employees just yesterday - she has been faithfully wearing her mask even while alone, due to the fear mongering, for the past year and just had 4 teeth pulled due to gum disease when she had never even been to a dentist for the prior 4 decades of her life. Here in Ontario we're entering the third "emergency" stand down (because the first two worked so well, I guess) and I've realized that this whole thing is beyond stupidity, incompetence, or mere negligence - it is intentional. When we had stunt drivers light a parking lot on fire with gasoline the other day, so they could do donuts for YouTube, and then attack the police who responded - only to flee and do the same thing twice at different locations later that eve - our response from Toronto mayor John Tory was: (paraphrasing) You see? This is why we need to lockdown the province again. Bad behaviour like this spreads the virus and we must protect everyone for their own good...

I can accept stupidity and incompetence - when it is recognised and rectified - so this is simply the intentional implementation of a preconceived agenda, which they actually admit to if you listen to what they say...

Â @SillydogificationÂ  Nope. It is well understood that it is contagious well before symptoms show. WHO suggests children (6+) wearing masks be based on transmission rates in the area and recommends educating children on using them properly.

"WHO and UNICEF advise that the decision to use masks for children agedÂ 6-11Â should be based on the following factors:

Whether there is widespread transmission in the area where the child resides

The ability of the child to safely and appropriately use a mask

Access to masks, as well as laundering and replacement of masks in certain settings (such as schools and childcare services)

Adequate adult supervision and instructions to the child on how to put on, take off and safely wear masks

Potential impact of wearing a mask on learning and psychosocial development, in consultation with teachers, parents/caregivers and/or medical providers

Specific settings and interactions the child has with other people who are at high risk of developing serious illness, such as the elderly and those with other underlying health conditions

WHO and UNICEF advise that children agedÂ 12 and overÂ should wear a mask under the same conditions as adults, in particular when they cannot guarantee at least a 1-metre distance from others and there is widespread transmission in the area."

Those who would give up essential Liberty, to purchase a little temporary Safety, deserve neither Liberty nor Safety.9 Such as were inclined to defend themselves, but unable to purchase Arms and Ammunition, have, as we are informed, been supplied with both, as far as Arms could be procured, out of Monies given by the last Assembly for the Kingâ€™s Use; and the large Supply of Money offered by this Bill, might enable the Governor to do every Thing else that should be judged necessary for their farther Security, if he shall think fit to accept it. Whether he could, as he supposes, â€œif his Hands had been properly strengthened, have put the Province into such a Posture of Defence, as might have prevented the present Mischiefs,â€ seems to us uncertain; since late Experience in our neighbouring Colony of Virginia (which had every Advantage for that Purpose that could be desired) shows clearly, that it is next to impossible to guard effectually an extended Frontier, settled by scattered single Families at two or three Miles Distance, so as to secure them from the insiduous Attacks of small Parties of skulking Murderers: But thus much is certain, that by refusing our Bills from Time to Time, by which great Sums were seasonably offered, he has rejected all the Strength that Money could afford him; and if his Hands are still weak or unable, he ought only to blame himself, or those who have tied them.
